channel.title: Server Standardization
channel.description:
So the main problems I see these days are:
1) People being confused as hell about environment variables 2) DDoS attacks
How many people would be interested in a tutorial to make somewhat of a "standard" server, run under a virtual machine? Was thinking of using Ubuntu server since it's basically a LAMP installation (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP). After that I would provide a script to set up any environment variables, and to download any extra needed packages (such as Snort for DDoS protection). I'd also configure a rules file for everyone to use with snort to drop any bogus network traffic. The hardest part would probably be getting people's network set up properly, but the software side of things would be completed. Another benefit of a Virtual Machine is that your own computer is at much less risk than it would be if you opened up your entire system to the network.
If people are interested, I could probably have a reasonable tutorial within a week's time, as I'm very busy right now. This would allow for people to have a server up and running very quickly, with the focus on customization instead of networking / setting up XAMPP properly / etc.
Thoughts?
